intro: Meriania coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red berries that appear in clusters, often remaining on the plant long after the leaves have fallen. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant fruit and attractive foliage.
